title: A REPORT CARD ON HUMAN RIGHTS IN AMERICA Part 1: Racism and Injustice
desc: In Honor of International Human Rights Day A two part series African Americans in Los Angeles are 260% more likely to be stopped than whites. (ref: American Civil Liberties Union and Yale Law School report) America has 5% of the world?s population and 25% of the world?s prisoners ? 2.2 million adults, costing $53 billion to the US states. Over half of those in prison are people of color. (ref: BBC) It?s estimated that close to 10,000 innocent Americans are wrongfully convicted of a serious crime each year. (ref: Ohio State University report) Refreshments, followed by presentations, panel discussion. The first of two forums on the state of human rights in the United States. Part 2 is:  Homelessness, Poverty and Hunger, How Do We Fix It? RSVP Part 2: bit.ly/HumanRightsPart2 Those attending both parts receive a certificate of  The Basics of Human Rights in America . Hosted by: Church of Scientology of Los Angeles   FAQs What is Part 2 of the event?   Part 2: Homelessness, Poverty and Hunger, How Do We Fix It? Youth for Human Rights International Issues the certificate.  What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? Parking is free at location. If you wish to take Metro, get off at the Vermont/Sunset stop of the Red Line and walk 2-3 blocks west.
